_header: And if ye command me to keep me true wherever I go
Note:
See Davis (1971)
XDavis, Norman. The Paston Letters and Papers of the Fifteenth Century. 2 vols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1971, 1976, No. 783.
_description: A love letter by Margery Brews to John Paston, 1477 — one 6-line stanza (three couplets), with preceding couplet

BLAdd43490.Transcription:
For þer wottys no creature what peyn þat I endureAnd for to
                    be deede I dare it not dyscureAnd yf ȝe commande me to kepe me true
                    where euer I goIwyse I will do all my myght and neuer no mo
                    ȝowe to loue and neuer no moAnd tho yf my freendys say
                    þat I do amys þei schuld not me let so for to doTruly ouer all
                    erthely thingAnd yf þei be neuer so wroth I tryst it schall be bettur
                    in tyme commyng
BLAdd43490.Note:
Supplement lists ‘Gairdner, III.170’ for orig. ed.
                    Written as prose. Several scribal corrections.
